query:
In 5 unrelated German pedigrees with epidermolytic PPK, including the family originally described by {30:Thost (1880)} and the family previously studied by {27:Reis et al. (1992)} with linkage to chromosome 17q11-q23, {26:Reis et al.
(1994)} identified heterozygosity for a missense mutation in the KRT9 gene (R162W; {607606.0001}). Two other missense mutations were also detected in 1 EPPK kindred each, N160K ({607606.0004}) and R162Q ({607606.0005}), respectively. All 3 mutations involved highly conserved residues in coil 1A of KRT9.
KRT9; epidermolytic palmoplantar keratoderma; EPPK; R162W; N160K; R162Q; N160Y; M156T; M156V; L160F; missense mutation; exon 1; heterozygosity; chromosome 17q11-q23; autosomal dominant; knuckle pads; breast cancer; ovarian cancer.
Epidermolytic palmoplantar keratoderma (EPPK) is associated with heterozygous missense mutations in the KRT9 gene, such as R162W, N160K, and R162Q, identified in various pedigrees, including German, Fâ€¦
